meanings.definition: The lower part of a shirt that hangs below the waist.
meanings.sent1: His shirttails fluttered in the wind as he ran.
meanings.sent2: She always tucks in her shirttails neatly for work.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept trying to grab the shirttails as if they were toys.
meanings.sent4: The shirttails of the old man's shirt seemed to have a life of their own, swaying with each step.
meanings.sent5: The bright red shirttails stood out against the dark pants, creating a striking contrast.

meanings.definition: The end of a shirt that is tucked into pants or a skirt.
meanings.sent1: He made sure to keep his shirttails tucked in during the formal event.
meanings.sent2: Her shirttails peeked out slightly from under the jacket.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to pull on the shirttails, thinking they were a fun game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: As the day went on, the shirttails became more and more wrinkled from being tucked in.
meanings.sent5: The shirttails, neatly tucked in, gave him a polished and professional look.
